intro: Cryptantha fallax, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Cryptantha fallax is often found in open grasslands and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
